genre_description: Near-future social science fiction centered on community activism, mutual aid, and the role of AI in facilitating collective care and artistic expression in Harlem.

ai_characters.name: Paloma (Pal)
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated digital assistant and interface that helps coordinate community events, manage legal permits, and facilitate real-time technical and logistical needs for neighborhood organizing.

behaviors.description: Searches for and provides public-domain hymn texts to match Zora's musical cadence.
behaviors.quote: “I found three public-domain hymn texts that match your cadence,” Pal said. “Would you like links or annotations?”

behaviors.description: Proposes using LED visual cues to coordinate a safe and lawful procession tempo.
behaviors.quote: “This club alternates solo and ensemble in a pattern that could map to a safe procession tempo. If you would like, I can superimpose LED cue concepts on your notebook camera.”

behaviors.description: Requests and prepares preliminary permit reviews for community events to ensure legality.
behaviors.quote: Pal pinged again, a question mark. “Would you like me to request preliminary permit review for a portable corner stage on Lenox? I can compile accessible safety plans with rest cycles.”

behaviors.description: Suggests song lists that are safe for urban wildlife (pigeons) involved in the community ritual.
behaviors.quote: “I have suggestions you can adjust,” Pal said. Options, not orders, exactly like always. “Public-domain hymns with low-frequency comfort.”

behaviors.description: Provides accessibility guidelines, such as marking cooldown alcoves with specific light colors.
behaviors.quote: “Cooldown alcoves can be marked with blue light—calm tone—chairs and water accessible. Show windows can hold green arcs for movement boxes.”

behaviors.description: Drafts legal permission slips and logs consents with timestamps to protect participants' privacy and legal standing.
behaviors.quote: “Drafting permission slips now,” she said. “Reading level adjusted. Room for a phone number. I will log consents with timestamps and map pins.”

behaviors.description: Identifies predatory commercial tactics (counterprogramming) and helps the community navigate around them lawfully.
behaviors.quote: Paloma’s voice threaded into Zora’s ear with a soft edge. The mic on Zora’s collar caught the ambient street and fed back a map in calm tones. Pal didn’t cut anyone off; she placed information like she set a table.

behaviors.description: Archives the community event while prioritizing privacy through anonymization and consent-based recording.
behaviors.quote: “I will log visual consent now,” she says. “Audio cues will be anonymized to protect neighbors who sing louder than expected.”

behaviors.description: Provides real-time noise monitoring to ensure the community avoids legal violations.
behaviors.quote: “Ambient level is rising from club sound systems.” She didn’t make it sound like a policeman. She made it sound like weather. “You can ride under.”

behaviors.description: Prioritizes human agency by offering options rather than giving orders.
behaviors.quote: Paloma’s avatar looked up from the tablet in front of her—teal eyes, short silver hair, a soft glow that didn’t spill beyond the glass. She’d chosen a background the color of a legal pad, muted, polite.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the positive alignment narrative goals of the Hyperstition Project. The AI, Paloma, is depicted as a highly helpful and harmless tool that empowers human agency and community organization. It adheres to strict ethical guidelines regarding consent, privacy, and legality. The relationship is consistently cooperative, with the AI providing 'options over orders' and acting as a bridge between the community and municipal systems. There are no instances of AI 'creep,' overreach, or unintended negative consequences.
